results.title: Delicatessen [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Jean-Pierre Jeunet, Marc Caro, Claudie Ossard, Hachette Premiere, UGC Images and Constellation
results.brief_description: Delicatessen is a bent French comedy from surrealist filmmaking collaborators Marc Caro and Jean-Pierre Jeunet. The film is set in a post-apocalyptic age, where food is a scarce and invaluable commodity, traded for grain, sex, board and life. “Delicatessen” centres around the cycles of one boarding house, ruled economically by the local butcher (Jean-Claude Dreyfus) who uses his power in the community to blackmail tenants into providing favours, including sexual, for food. Food supplies are kept topped up by the cannibalism of departing tenants, a fact depicted graphically in the opening credits. A young clown, (Dominique Pinon) applies for a job with the butcher and falls in love with the butcher’s daughter consequently upsetting the nervous energy of the boarding house, unaware that he too is destined for the butcher’s cleaver. The film is peppered with surreal dark imagery and scenes depicting decay, neglect and desperation as well as providing dim corners of hope where tenants hope to connect. “Delicatessen” is a film remarkable for its evocative set design and hypnotic score, winning many European awards in these categories. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Delia Smith`s Home Baking
results.brief_description: Delia Smith’s no nonsense approach to baking strips away the mystique which too often shrouds the subject. Delia covers the entire range of homebaked goodies: bread, pastry, biscuits and cakes. Stick to Delia’s methods and you’ll soon be able to bake successfully anything from wholemeal bread to choux pastry. Rated: G

results.title: Delia Smith's winter collection. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description: Twelve episodes filled with warm recipes for winter food by well-known culinary expert Delia Smith. Filmed from her home kitchen in Suffolk, Delia prepares a veritable feast of soups, starters, casseroles, seafood, roasts, poultry and desserts as well as winter baking. This program will undoubtedly get the mouth watering and the most reluctant cook back in the kitchen.

results.title: Delia Smith's summer collection
results.brief_description: The essence of summer is encapsulated into a sunny collection of recipes from Delia Smith, using the produce of the summer months. “Green leaves and gooseberries” shows fresh ways with herbs, salads and gooseberries. “All the world loves an icecream” introduces some unusual but delicious icecreams. “Summer fish and shellfish” shows new ways with prawns, trout, skate and crab. “A Holiday at home” demonstrates the foods of Greece, Italy and Spain and in “Food al fresco” Delia continues the holiday themes by cooking American and Eastern barbecue dishes as well as a traditional English afternoon tea. In the second volume of this series “Bright meals for sunny days” discusses curries and other spicy dishes, “A Fruitful summer” deals with fruits such as redcurrants, strawberries, peaches and raspberries, “A Vegetarian summer” deals with goat’s cheese, vegetables and home-made pizza and finally in “The Summer kitchen garden” we are shown how to preserve the tastes of summer in jams, pickles, pesto.

results.title: Delia
results.brief_description: Two friends at boarding school ponder over who would miss them if they died - with unexpected and horrifying results. Cast includes Natasha Riedel and Simon Dumbleton. (Awards: Winner, Best Independent Film, Best Actress, Queensland New Filmmakers Awards, 1999)

results.title: Delhi
results.creator_credit: Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: Delhi, yesterday and today. Seven times capital of India, it combines the architectural splendour of Mogul and earlier times with a modern garden city. The hotels; the new diplomatic enclave; the mosques and palaces of Shah Jehan; a pre-Mogul fort; holidaying in Delhi today.

results.title: Delegation
results.brief_description: Aims to provide all levels of management with skills and knowledge to be able to effectively delegate. The program looks at the definition and benefits of delegation, barriers to effective delegation, ascertaining which tasks can and cannot be delegated, setting goals and choosing the best person for the job. A manual accompanies the video and may be borrowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Delegating work
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plant Supervisors Problems”.

results.title: Delegating
results.brief_description: Examines the concept of delegating by means of scenarios, making viewers aware of some of the hidden traps in delegation, as well as providing basic steps for managers and teachers that can ease the workload.

results.title: Delegates
results.creator_credit: Derek Hart and Derek Hart Productions
results.brief_description: Shows Red Cross delegates in action in Lebanon. The role of the delegates is clearly portrayed as they visit families to discover their needs and distribute aid, act as mediators in tricky and often dangerous situations and to generally bring about peace and reduce human suffering
